commits.message: Regenerate doc/parser.png
Fix bug causing only the chunk of a subnegotiation with the IAC SE at the end to be emitted.
Fix an odd missing q->remote change.
Copypasta is bad, kids.
Fix missing toggle callbacks after negotiation hook
Update README
Add check to telnet_send_subnegotiaton() for if the option is open for subnegotiating.
Change return type of telnet_negotiate_event_callback to unsigned char
Replaced telopt lazy mechanism with negotiation hook
Fix missing lazy-bit assignment.
Ensure that state is updated before callbacks are fired.
Ensure that the telopt callback has the most up-to-date state when it's called.
Fix documentation typo
Ensure that subnegotiation/data events are only sent to telopts that have been enabled.
Change 'Channels' heading in README to 'Telopts'
Major rearchitecting of the channels concept to make it less brittle and hard-to-use.
Version bump to 0.2.2 for bugfix.
Change accidental DO to WILL. Fix #1.
Fix memory leak, fix potential error state in parser, add a few clarifying comments.
Add the graph visualization to the doc/ directory, and add a (previously-ignored) file on Telnet channels to the repository.
Move the graph visualization from the Rakefile to the Makefile, and remove the Rakefile.
Fix src/README.md
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:Twisol/anachronism
Add README for the src/ directory.
fix linebreak
Add link for libtelnet
fix minor README issue
Updated README
Fix a bug (current_remote must be initialized to TELNET_MAIN_CHANNEL), and implemented telnet_channel_get_status().
Remove the telnet_nvt* parameter from telnet_channel_new() and move it to telnet_channel_register().

Implement two conspicuously missing functions: telnet_channel_unregister() and
telnet_channel_free().

An interrupt code can be passed to telnet_interrupt(), and retrived with
telnet_get_last_interrupt().

Implement telnet_channel_get_option() to retreive the option the channel is
bound to.

Fix bug in telnet_nvt_new(), where if the parser couldn't be allocated, the
NVT would be returned without being initialized.

Add some documentation, implement telnet_channel_toggle(), and change
telnet_halt() to telnet_interrupt().
Major overhaul, splitting the Ragel parser interface into its own file and implementing an entirely new "channels" mechanism for handling telopts.
Renamed anachromism.c/h/o/rl to nvt.c/h/o/rl.
Improve build process and move include files to their own directory.
Refactor IAC command parsing to allow anything except WILL/WONT/DO/DONT/IAC/SB/SE as a basic command.
Actually, just remove the else branch altogether since it's wholly pointless. (The comment, however, stays.)
Add braces (thanks, gcc warning) and compile the *.rl changes.

Fix telnet_escape implementation so that "
" doesn't get escaped as "\0
", which is clearly ridiculous.  should only be escaped if 
 doesn't immediately follow it, and 
 should never be escaped at all.
Change README to reflect the fact that this isn't locked to Ruby anymore.
Remove unused tasks
Splitting repository, moving ext/ to src/
Refactor for gcc warnings
add comments
Rename the C files to reflect the library better.

Rename most API calls to (1) remove the _nvt prefix and (2) add _send to the outgoing data functions.
Rename the built library to libanachronism (from just anachronism).

Rename telnet_nvt_text to telnet_nvt_data, and TELNET_EV_TEXT to TELNET_EV_DATA. (telnet_nvt.h, telnet_nvt.rl, anachronism.c)
Add a number of comments to elucidate some things. (telnet_nvt.h, telnet_nvt.rl)
Remove the telnet_byte typename, replacing it with an unnamed enum. (telnet_nvt.h, telnet_nvt.rl)
Add checks to the parser in case the on_recv callback is set during parsing, in which case the data buffer would be NULL as parsing continues. (telnet_nvt.rl)
Handle allocation failure in telnet_nvt_new. (telnet_nvt.rl)
Factor out the telnet escaping functionality from telnet_nvt_data into a new function telnet_escape. (telnet_nvt.rl)
Improve behavior of telnet_nvt_subnegotiation by collectng the whole subnegotiation sequence into a single buffer first. This also helps catch allocation errors early. (telnet_nvt.rl)
Reorder the telnet_error values so that TELNET_E_ALLOC coincides with 0 (NULL). (telnet_nvt.h)

Handle TELNET_E_ALLOC in parser_allocate (anachronism.c)
Improve command<->symbol translation method (anachronism.c)

Add named error codes.
Implement telnet_nvt_subnegotiation, as well as begin_subnegotiation and end_subnegotiation to allow streaming subnegotiation data.
Tidy up the telnet_nvt_text character-escaping loop.
Remove the increasingly bare Anchronism::NVT class, and rename Anachronism::Native to Anachronism::NVT.

Condense NVT callbacks to just on_recv and on_send, passing an event structure to on_recv.
Implement parser_send_subnegotiation(), and rename telnet_nvt_parse() to telnte_nvt_rect().
Implement telnet_nvt_option.
Restructure the C-side parser API to be less intrusive on the telnet_nvt structure. Remove all of the processing except the Ruby<->C data translations from the glue code.
Implemented NVT#halt, which allows you to interrupt the NVT during its parsing. The data that wasn't processed is then returned from NVT#process.
Fixed subnegotiation handling.
Implemented NVT#send_command.
Implemented telnet_nvt_text() in C.

Refactored the Telnet grammar to handle text better by buffering text until another event occurs.

Bumped version to 0.0.5, not that it means anything.
Changed telnet_nvt_recv to telnet_nvt_parse.
Renamed Parser to NVT. Fixed stupid off-by-one issue in NVT#send_option.
Added license, readme, and bumped the version.
Parser#process now yield events as they occur instead of bufferin them in an array. Also began adding tests.
Fixed issue where every byte in a subnegotiation would trigger a text event, rather than one for a single stretch.
Changed uppercase symbols to lowercase (will, wont, do, dont), and added some primitive outbound processing.
Made anachronism into a working gem.
Telnet stream parser is now working.
First commit

issue_comments.body:
Good catch! The tell-tale sign it's wrong is that it's the same in both the DONT and WONT branches.

I'll push a fix later today; I'm not on my Linux partition at the moment.
